concept_data.title: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa

summary: The term "BRICS countries" refers to the collective grouping of Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa, which plays a significant role in the global economic landscape. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the BRICS nations are often analyzed for their economic geography and influence on international trade policies. The EU engages with these countries to foster cooperation on various regulatory matters, including trade agreements and sustainable development initiatives. This redirect from "Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa" to "BRICS countries" underscores the preferred terminology used in EU documents to streamline discussions regarding these emerging economies.
